instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3209 Prohibited sign
threads.message: Got an 820-3209 that had a tiny bit of liquid damage to backlight area. Repaired, tried to boot and it gives me the prohibited symbol. Iv'e ran into this problem like twice before and cannot fix. From what I understand, this means it cannot load macos due to corruption on the SSD Is this correct?

threads.title: 820-3209 Prohibited sign
threads.message:
What macOS version did you try?
Is the original SSD inside?
Try booting USB test macOS.

threads.title: 820-3209 Prohibited sign
threads.message: Original SSD was inside. After a few tries of it restarting I got it to work but it is running slow. The CPU is really hot. HW Monitor shows the CPU is consuming 3 watts, not sure if that is a normal thing.

threads.title: 820-3209 Prohibited sign
threads.message: I meant to say I was able to get it to run Catalina on an external USB SSD

threads.title: 820-3209 Prohibited sign
threads.message:
USB macOS recognizes internal SSD in Disk Utility?
Can you format it?

Try clean ME BIOS, just in case...

threads.title: 820-3209 Prohibited sign
threads.message: Ended up putting a new SSD in it
